stimulusHtml: Light of wavelength λ that delivers energy at a rate R will not eject electrons from a certain metal. Increasing the rate of energy delivery without changing the wavelength has no effect. Light of wavelength λ/2 that delivers energy at a rate R does cause electrons to be ejected from the metal. Which of the following claims can be made based on this result?
choicesHtml: Light is behaving as a wave in this case.
Light is behaving as a particle in this case.
Light is behaving as both a particle and a wave in this case.
This experiment provides no information on the nature of light.
